item.title: Report E-2023090773
item.description:
Report E-2023090773

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 21, 2023 one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was punctured while in transit and released approximately less-than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from OMI/E3 to remediate the impacted site. OMI/E3 did not observed any released material on the pallet or trailer floor. The crew placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum for transport and disposal. OMI/E3 staged the material onsite to be processed via R+Ls normal waste stream.

item.title: Report X-2023090409
item.description:
Report X-2023090409

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023090409 SequenceEvent: A discoloration of the packaging was noticed before being loaded on Saturday morning, pkg was brought to QA for inspection. QA inspected box and contents of the box. DescribePack: Loose cap is the cause of the failure DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: item was placed in a designated bin and set in the upright position to prevent further leakage. 2. X-2023090411 SequenceEvent: discoloration on repackaged box notice during unloading, pkg was placed in upright position then taken to qa for inspection, pkg was inspected, contents of pkg was inspected DescribePack: Inspection of pkg shows the failure was loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: pkg was set in the direction of the orientation arrows.

item.title: Report X-2023090388
item.description:
Report X-2023090388

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was damaged during preload where it was then placed in front of the hazmat cage for it to be looked at. When box was inspected the package was in a tote, when it was opened at the top the and the packing material was removed one of the four glass bottles had a loose cap on it the other bottles were all tight. When I lifted the bottle with the loose cap on it up, you could see a cup of liquid was gone from the glass bottle. When I removed all of the glass bottles from the box, I lifted the package up and saw one of the bottom flaps had come open. DescribePack: one of the bottles of isopropanol had a loose cap and the others didn't. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Bay doors, fans on and package was to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023090387

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Was found leaking during transit and driver gave it to QA; package had no hazmat markings, hazmat labels, or was not declare a hazmat DescribePack: Both cans inside box was hitting/rubbing up on each other during transit that cause friction for one of the cans to leak from it's seal DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Took package away from VSA/QA and got in a salvage drum asap

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO DOOR, THE PACKAGE WAS OUTSIDE OF THE TRAILER NEXT TO THE ROLLERS. RESPONDER NOTED PACKAGE HAD A CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL AND PROCEEDED TO DON FULL PPE. RESPONDER COLLECTED THE PACKAGE AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE HAD LEAKED BUT NOT ESCAPED THE BOX.

INSIDE, 1 OF FOUR BOTTLES HAS A LOOSE LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED. CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM.

item.description:
Report X-2023090351

  • City: MESQUITE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped by pickoff on load side 2 by door 118, cracking the bottom. QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to prevent injuries. DescribePack: Package was dropped by pickoff, cracking the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to prevent injuries.

DescribePack: all caps from the bottles have been cracked and loosened. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: package was put into a tote to prevent any other leakage from package.

item.title: Report X-2023090311
item.description:

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found soiled by pink paint and inspected in Hazmat storage area. DescribePack: 40 spray cans of Rust O-Leum Inverted Marking Paint were counted. 2 had nozzles that were broken off. Others were missing their plastic caps. There were 2 inner boxes each containing 6 of the same product. Other cans were loose inside of the box. No cans felt completely empty. Pink paint was seen throughout package. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading.

Report X-2023090310

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in a salvage drum outside of Hazmat processing cage. Outer box was torn and wet. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of two one gallon bottles of Diversey Bravo was crushed causing complete leakage. The other bottle was soiled by the leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a plastic bag inside of a salvage drum when found.

item.title: Report X-2023090302
item.description:
Report X-2023090302

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was damaged during pre-load, someone had put the box in a silver cage in front of QA. I saw the damage hazmat in the silver cage and took it right over to the hazmat cage where the bay doors and fans were on. Inspecting the package, I found a piece of cardboard was on top of the bottles which helped with transportation, but when I lifted it up, I saw that the seal of one of the tops was ripped and the cap was nowhere to be. I looked for the cap, but no one knows where it is. The other three jugs/bottles are fine they were not damaged, but the one without the cap to it had possibly two cups of liquid evaporated. The side of the box looked like it was wet, but it is now dry. DescribePack: Seal was ripped and cap was off of the bottle. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Bay doors open and fans were on along with moved to a separate location.

item.title: Report X-2023090291
item.description:
Report X-2023090291

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found leaking hazmat at the end of the day in unload, not sure of time of leak occurred or who placed it into a lined red hazmat tote (i keep them lines hazmat toes in each area for situations such as these). I grabbed PPE blue gloved, fully opened the shipment for inspection and saw 4, 1 gallon plastic jugs. One of the caps was loose and leaking. DescribePack: loose cap on plastic bottle. I am not sure if the shipment was properly placed into Trailor, i was not made aware of the leak when it occurred. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: leaking hazmat was placed into lined red hazmat tote

DescribePack: Upon inspection, all 4 of the one gallon plastic bottles were almost equally full but one appeared slightly less full than the others. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Package was placed into a salvage drum during inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023090247
item.description:
Report X-2023090247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was on the shelf waiting for the customer to call back about the gate code when there was a spot on the corner of the box. Inspecting the box and contents the corner of the box had plastie part A that had come from the bottom of the metal canister that had been dented/punctured luckily that was the only part that was damaged the Part B is fine and not damaged thankfully. DescribePack: The box itself did not fail it was the padding under the metal can that failed. The can had been punctured/dented on the bottom. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: there was no smell nor was it coming out of the box, but it was brought over to the hazmat cage where the bay doors open and fans are on.

item.title: Report X-2023082069
item.description:
Report X-2023082069

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was left at hazmat cage with no information given. Package was processed as quickly as possible. DescribePack: The package was found to have a loose cap and one missing bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was inside a red hazmat tote by the hazmat cage. What procedures were taken is unknown.

item.title: Report I-2023060179
item.description:
Report I-2023060179

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T00:32:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: Houston
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EXXON MOBILE PIPELINE COM
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The carrier, Roberson Trucking Co., Inc.(672 Three Creeks Rd., Junction City, AR, 71749, USDOT#535803) was unaware that the salt water load they had picked up had elevated levels of hydrogen sulfide. Upon receiving the truck believed to be ordinary brine water, an EMTEC employee decided to check the headspace for H^S as a precaution. Upon doing so, 15,000 ppm of H^S were detected. EMTEC personnel devised a plan to safely offload the material. Since the Friendswood Test Facility(FTF) lab is already equipped with large Material Absorption Devices(MAD Units) for catalytically destroying H2S, hoses were Connected from the FTF frac tank to the MAD Units to purge the gas in the headspace after the material transfer from the tanker. The pumps were run until the tanker was offloaded. The frac tank venting to the MAD Units was continued for 48 hours until testing showed the H^S concentrations at 0 ppm, at which time the brine water was deemed safe. Area monitoring was also conducted to ensure safe conditions in the surrounding area. The driver was notified immediately and the driver contacted his management immediately by phone that the load was sour.
